trans-unit.source: Overview of Azure DNS | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Overview of Azure DNS | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Overview of Azure DNS hosting services on Microsoft Azure and start hosting your domain on Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Overview of Azure DNS hosting services on Microsoft Azure and start hosting your domain on Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure DNS Overview
trans-unit.target: Azure DNS Overview

trans-unit.source: Behind any website or service on the Internet, there is an IP address.
trans-unit.target: Behind any website or service on the Internet, there is an IP address.

trans-unit.source: For example, www.microsoft.com uses the IP address 134.170.185.46.
trans-unit.target: For example, www.microsoft.com uses the IP address 134.170.185.46.

trans-unit.source: The Domain Name System, or DNS, is responsible for translating (or resolving) the website or service name to its IP address.
trans-unit.target: The Domain Name System, or DNS, is responsible for translating (or resolving) the website or service name to its IP address.

trans-unit.source: Azure DNS is a hosting service for DNS domains, providing name resolution using Microsoft Azure infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Azure DNS is a hosting service for DNS domains, providing name resolution using Microsoft Azure infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: By hosting your domains in Azure, you can manage your DNS records using the same credentials, APIs, tools and billing as your other Azure services.
trans-unit.target: By hosting your domains in Azure, you can manage your DNS records using the same credentials, APIs, tools and billing as your other Azure services.

trans-unit.source: DNS domains in Azure DNS are hosted on Azure’s global network of DNS name servers.
trans-unit.target: DNS domains in Azure DNS are hosted on Azure’s global network of DNS name servers.

trans-unit.source: We use Anycast networking, so that each DNS query is answered by the closest available DNS server.
trans-unit.target: We use Anycast networking, so that each DNS query is answered by the closest available DNS server.

trans-unit.source: This provides both fast performance and high availability for your domain.
trans-unit.target: This provides both fast performance and high availability for your domain.

trans-unit.source: The service is based on Azure Resource Manager (ARM).
trans-unit.target: The service is based on Azure Resource Manager (ARM).

trans-unit.source: Your domains and records can be managed via Azure Resource Manager REST APIs, .NET SDK, PowerShell cmdlets and command line interface.
trans-unit.target: Your domains and records can be managed via Azure Resource Manager REST APIs, .NET SDK, PowerShell cmdlets and command line interface.

trans-unit.source: Azure DNS is currently in Preview, and is not yet supported in the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: Azure DNS is currently in Preview, and is not yet supported in the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: Azure DNS does not currently support purchasing of domain names.
trans-unit.target: Azure DNS does not currently support purchasing of domain names.

trans-unit.source: To purchase domains you should use a third-party domain name registrar, who will typically charge a small annual fee.
trans-unit.target: To purchase domains you should use a third-party domain name registrar, who will typically charge a small annual fee.

trans-unit.source: These domains can then be hosted in Azure DNS for management of DNS records—see [Delegate a Domain to Azure DNS](dns-domain-delegation.md) for details.
trans-unit.target: These domains can then be hosted in Azure DNS for management of DNS records—see [Delegate a Domain to Azure DNS](dns-domain-delegation.md) for details.

trans-unit.target: Next Steps
